creator: admin949

content: As long as archives is a "special" folder for Thunderbird - it has a special icon because you have it configured in Thunderbird to contain archives for the account - you won't be able to delete it.
creator: wsmwk

content:
You can hide it though:

In the L. column, R. click the account (just above the Inbox) > Subscribe > untick Archives

Also go to TB menu > Account Settings > Server Settings > click the 'Advanced' button and make sure 'Show only subscribed folders' is enabled.
creator: siffemoz

content:
See if it's subscribed:

In the L. column, R. click the account (just above the Inbox) > Subscribe. If it's there, tick it and see if it appears.

If not there, without uninstalling reinstall TB from https://www.thunderbird.net/en-US/thunderbird/all/.
creator: siffemoz

content: Right-click the Start button (or press Windows+X), and select Apps and Features. Select the drop down list Choose where to get Apps, and set it to Anywhere. Then try installing Thunderbird again.

Yes, it is possible, as I have found out. In userChrome.css it is those columns:

  • .calendar-task-tree-col-categories
  • #calendar-task-tree-col-completed
  • .calendar-task-tree-col-percentcomplete
  • #calendar-task-tree-col-priority
  • .calendar-task-tree-col-title

content:
I may be misunderstanding your question, but Thunderbird does offer the ability to copy complete profiles (all accounts and settings and locally-stored messages) to other PCs. Here are the basics:

Here is the link for moving a profile in Windows when installed in default location: 

https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/moving-thunderbird-data-to-a-new-computer

here is the info in brief steps:

  1. ensure thunderbird is NOT running on old machine
  2. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  3. this should open windows file explorer in Appdata\roaming folder
  4. highlight the Thunderbird folder and copy to external media
  5. ensure thunderbird is installed on second computer and NOT running
  6. enter %appdata% in search window on task bar and press Enter key
  7. you should be in Appdata\roaming folder , copy&paste the exported Thunderbird folder there. This may prompt to overwrite an existing folder of same name. allow it
  8. start thunderbird and all should be there
creator: davidsk

content: Duplicate emails can be caused by sync issues or mail server glitches. Try using a dedicated duplicate remover add-on (like for Thunderbird or Outlook), and check your account settings to avoid repeated downloads. Also, make sure filters or rules aren’t accidentally copying messages into folders.

content:
Per eliminare l'account: - Crea una o più cartelle sotto Cartelle locali di Thunderbird - Copia la posta che vuoi conservare in queste cartelle - Verifica che la copia sia corretta e completa - Elimina l'account

La richiesta di password tuttavia potrebbe anche arrivare da altre funzioni. Ad esempio se hai collegato un calendari remoto.
creator: @next

content:
Per poter inquadrare il problema prova a fornire queste informazioni:

  1. Versione di Thunderbird
  2. Versione del sistema operativo
  3. Provider delle caselle email (Gmail, Libero, Hotmail, etc.)
  4. Tipologia di account (POP3, IMAP)
  5. Estensioni installate
  6. Messaggi di errore che vengono visualizzati durante l'utilizzo di Thunderbird
  7. Software di sicurezza eventualmente presenti (Antivirus e simili)
  8. Screenshot del problema (se utile a chiarire il contesto)
creator: @next

content: Dit artikel legt uit waar de profielgegevens van Thunderbird zich bevinden: https://support.mozilla.org/nl/kb/profielen-waar-thunderbird-gebruikersgegevens-bewaart. Wellicht zijn daar ook de mappen terug te vinden.
creator: Mozilla-assistent

content: That is probably a Gmail account. You do not need them and the general recommendation is to unsubscribe from them.The messages stored there are duplicates of your other mail folder. By unsubscribing, you reduce disk space 50% and computer resources for sending and receiving. Unsubscribing does not delete the messages. This URL has more info: https://support.mozilla.org/en-US/kb/thunderbird-and-gmail#
creator: davidsk
